intro:
Welcome to my website! I'm Caleb Richardson, a Python developer, avid self-learner and passionate for traveling. My journey in coding began right in high school and hasn't stopped. I specialize in Python, and I am looking to get my first programming job and start my career.

On this site, you'll find a showcase of my project portfolio with links and possibly deployed projects for an initial production environment. I'm always eager to connect with people, add to my portfolio, and my skills so feel free to connect with me on my socials.

Thank you for visiting!

work_history.title: Software Technician I
tasks: Created programs to filter, retrive, and manipulate data from AVEVA PI Systems
Admistrative tasks on databases, such as resource and storage monitoring
Created complex, including dynamically created queries/ stored proceedures
Communicated with global team members and clients

work_history.title: Test Engineer
tasks: Programmed new and modified existing functions for power monitoring functions such as surge, swell, and sag detection
Measured resistance and checked continuity of power monitoring panels

work_history.title: Contract Engineer
tasks: Created app implimenting matrix for in person collected data

work_history.title: Intern
tasks: Create projects to show the Design Process
Created internal tool to show all available tools in workshop areas

projects.name: Portfolio/ Resume Website
projects.description: This project is what you are seeing! It's this whole website dedicated to telling you about me and giving a place to show off my projects.

projects.name: Automated Personal Finance
projects.description:
This project is for tracking my monthly expenses. It uses online bank's exported CSV files in combination with user defined rules to automatically put purchases into categories. This way you don't have to go through each transaction every month to categorize by hand.
 There is not a lot of customization for online budget trackers since they have predefined categorizes and their own way of automatically categoizing.

projects.name: Steam Library Comparer
projects.description: This project is for people who use Steam and Discord and is for finding common games between two users. Ideally two people on Discord find eachother through a common server and want to play together and use my discord bot to find a common game between both of their Steam libraries.

projects.name: Single Player Racko
projects.description: This project is meant to give me experiance with stacks and queues data structures beyond just example functions. This is a simple game that uses stacks and queue opperations to organize numbers.
